  • name – the name of the dataset

  • asset_path – the path where the dataset will be saved

  • version – the version of the datset

autoop.core.ml.metric module

class autoop.core.ml.metric.Accuracy[source]

Bases: Metric

Class for the calculation of accuracy

evaluate(predicted_truth: ndarray, actual_truth: ndarray) → float[source]

The metric function to calculate the accuracy.

Args: predicted_truth: the ground truth predicted by the model actual_truth: the ground truth given in the database

Returns:

The percentage of matching predicted and actual truths

class autoop.core.ml.metric.CohensKappa[source]

Bases: Metric

Class that computes Cohen’s Kappa

evaluate(predicted_truth: ndarray, actual_truth: ndarray) → float[source]

The metric function to calculate Cohen’s Kappa.

Parameters:

  • predicted_truth – the predicted truths made by the model

  • actual_truth – the ground truth given in the database

Returns:

The degree to which the model’s predictions agree with the true values. The closer to 1, the better.

class autoop.core.ml.metric.MeanAbsolutePercentageError[source]

Bases: Metric

Class for the calculation of the mean absolute percentage error

evaluate(predicted_truths: ndarray, actual_truths: ndarray) → float[source]

The metric function to calculate the mean absolute percentage error.

Parameters:

  • predicted_truth – the predicted truths made by the model

  • actual_truth – the ground truth given in the database

Returns:

The average degree to which the predicted value differs from the actual value expressed in percentages

class autoop.core.ml.metric.MeanSquaredError[source]

Bases: Metric

Class for the calculation of the mean squared error

evaluate(predicted_truth: ndarray, actual_truth: ndarray) → float[source]

The metric function to calculate the mean squared error.

Args: predicted_truth: the ground truth predicted by the model actual_truth: the ground truth given in the database

Returns:

The average error of the difference between all predicted and actual truths

class autoop.core.ml.metric.RSquaredScore[source]

Bases: Metric

Class which computes the R^2 score.

evaluate(predicted_truths: ndarray, actual_truths: ndarray) → float[source]

Metric function that calculates the R^2 score of a model.

Parameters:

  • predicted_truth – the predicted truths made by the model

  • actual_truth – the ground truth given in the database

Returns:

How well the model fits the data. The closer to 1, the better.
